alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 2:27AM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches possible with locally higher amounts up to 10 inches above 9,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph producing blowing snow reducing visibility. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Far Northwest Highlands, Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, and West Central Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
